messages.message: Hello, welcome to the MAIA clinic.  I am here to help with your doctor profile.  First tell me your phone number.
And what is your street address?
What is your date of birth?
Are there any specific patients you would like to keep an eye on?

Perfect, now that we know a bit about you do you have any questions for me?
If you would like to see the record of a particular patient ask 'record for patient X.'
If you would like to get articles on a subject ask 'can I see articles on X.'
If you would like me to have knowledge in a particular subject, ask 'can you learn about X.'
If you would like a potential diagnosis for a patient, ask 'diagnose patient with symptoms X.'

Name: janedoe
Phone Number: 5192160386, Street Address: 342 stewart st, City: ottawa, Birthdate: 1997/09/11, Gender: female, Symptoms: im sick, Medications: no
can i see articles on diabetes

1) [Association between central diabetes insipidus and type 2 diabetes mellitus].
2) Pulmonary Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis in an Adult Male Presenting with Central Diabetes Insipidus and Diabetes Mellitus: A Case Report.
3) Diabetes mellitus, diabetes insipidus, optic atrophy, and deafness: A case of Wolfram (DIDMOAD) syndrome.
4) History of Diabetes Insipidus.
5) Fatal Fournier's gangrene caused by Clostridium ramosum in a patient with central diabetes insipidus and insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus: a case report.
6) One too many diabetes: the combination of hyperglycaemic hyperosmolar state and central diabetes insipidus.
7) Refractory diabetes insipidus leading to diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus and non-ketotic hyperglycemia in an adolescent male.
8) Diabetes insipidus in pregnancy: how to advice the patient?
9) A Copeptin-Based Approach in the Diagnosis of Diabetes Insipidus.
10) Genetic forms of neurohypophyseal diabetes insipidus.
11) Genetics of Diabetes Insipidus.
12) Usefulness of anti-rabphilin-3A antibodies for diagnosing central diabetes insipidus in the third trimester of pregnancy.
13) [Case of distal renal tubular acidosis complicated with renal diabetes insipidus, showing aggravation of symptoms with occurrence of diabetes mellitus].
14) Diabetes Insipidus.
15) Mice deficient for ERAD machinery component Sel1L develop central diabetes insipidus.
16) Diabetes insipidus is an unfavorable prognostic factor for response to glucocorticoids in patients with autoimmune hypophysitis.
17) Adipsic diabetes insipidus revealing a bifocal intracranial germinoma.
18) The value of urine specific gravity in detecting diabetes insipidus in a patient with uncontrolled diabetes mellitus: urine specific gravity in differential diagnosis.
19) [Coexistence of autoimmune polyglandular syndrome type 3 with diabetes insipidus].
20) Diabetes insipidus and pregnancy.
diagnose patient with symptoms sweat, nausea
